minecolonies.config.turnoffexplosionsinc: コロニーでの爆発をオフにする

Independent from the colony protection, should explosions be turned off inside colonies? DAMAGE_NOTHING prevents explosions completely. DAMAGE_PLAYERS, allows explosions to damage players and hostile mobs, but not blocks or neutral or friendly mobs. DAMAGE_ENTITIES allows damage to all entities. DAMAGE_EVERYTHING allows explosions to damage entities and blocks.

minecolonies.config.fishingroddurability: Offset for the maximum durability unenchanted rod a T1 Fishing Hut can use, compared to other wooden tools (59). Vanilla rods always work, but equivalents would need +6. Default value allows up to Thermal Foundation Silver  Anything below -59 will only allow vanilla rods.

Offset for the maximum durability unenchanted rod a T2 Fishing Hut can use, compared to iron tools (250). Thermal Foundation Iron requires +6. T3 huts can use unenchanted rods of any durability level, so long as they can take damage at all. Anything below -250 will only allow vanilla rods, except as allowed by T1.

com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: §6 MineColoniesへようこそ。 さて、物資が揃ったところで、コロニーを作るための市庁舎を設置する場所を探してみてはいかがでしょうか。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: §6 新しく設立されたコロニーの情報が入ってきた。市庁舎の周りに充分なスペースがあれば、もうじきあなたのコロニーに入植者が入植するだろう。 (経験豊富な統治者は、市庁舎ブロックでこれらの有用なメッセージをオフにすることができます。)
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: §6 最初の入植者がコロニーにやってきた！あなたの入植を始めるために、建築事務所を設置しよう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 素晴らしい建築事務所の配置だ！けれども、充分ではない。 建築事務所にアクセスし、建築を始めるをクリックしよう！ やがて、あなたの市民は、コロニーのための新しい建造物を作るようになるだろう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: §6 あなたの建築家が仕事している間に、彼が必要としている資源を建築のGUIの次のページで確認できる。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 建築事務所が完成したので、次は資源の生産に目を向けましょう。おそらく、植林場や鉱坑、そして市民を収容する酒場を手に入れるべきでしょう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: §6 資源を生産するとエネルギーが消費され、入植者が空腹になります。あなたは農場や釣り小屋、 動物飼いの小屋を建てるてたくなるでしょう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: §6 あなたの町が活気にあふれてきました。生産性を向上するために建物をアップグレードしたくなるでしょう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 今やすべての初期入植者が雇われました。更なる入植者を引き付けるためには、彼らの家を建てたりアップグレードしたりする必要がある。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: §6 今やすべての入植者がいい感じの家を持っているようですね。更なる入植者を手に入れるために、もっと家を建てよう！
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 最後の初期市民がコロニーにやってきた。新しく子どもを産むために家を建てて、そこに男女の市民を配置しよう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: §6 新たな入植者があなたのコロニーに到着した。そして、蛮族のスパイが成長中の村を見つけたという知らせを持ってきた。監視塔を建てたくなるかも！
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: §6 植民地が成長することは責任が大きくなることを意味します。入植者に充分な食事を提供し続けるために、レストランの設置を検討するべきだ。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: §6 市民はあなたに倉庫を建てることを強く求めています。そうすれば、バックパックも軽くなるし、材料も早く手に入るかもしれない！
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: §6 倉庫を建てました。しかし、今のままでは人々がそれを埋めるにはあまりにもタスクが多すぎるのです。いくつか宅配便の小屋を建設して、配達人を雇おう。倉庫レベルごとに最大2名まで勤務できる。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: §6 入植者はスキルがレベリング速度に影響すると言っている。市庁舎の設定でオンになっていれば、手動で市民を雇うことができます。仕事に最適なスキルは、採用の際に強調されます。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: §6 労働者たちは職場までの長い道のりに不満を抱いている。市庁舎の設定でオプションがオンになっていれば、最も近い家に手動で割り当てることができる。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: §6 コロニーが大きくなると、入植者の負担が大きくなる。仕事小屋をアップグレードすることを検討すべきだ。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: §6 あなたの植民地の隣で蛮族のスパイが捕まった！彼はより大きなグループから来たようだ。コロニーを守るために、兵舎を建てることを検討するべきだ。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.citize: §6 あなたのコロニーの人口は現在の管理技術の限界まで成長しました。より多くの市民を受け入れられるように、大学での研究を完了させよう。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: §6 利用可能な職業よりも多くの家を建てることは、市民の幸福度に悪影響をもたらす。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: §6 新しい子ども、%sは%sで幸せに暮らしています！
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.childg: %sは成長し、職を求めています。
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.hireci: §6あなたの募集パッケージが承諾され、新しい市民が到着した！

advancements.minecolonies.root.descripti: 支給キャンプか支給船をクラフトし、地面に向かって右クリックして設置する
advancements.minecolonies.place_townhall: 建築ツールを使って市庁舎を設置する。 - この道具を使うとスタイルと場所を選ぶことが出来る。
advancements.minecolonies.create_build_r: 建築事務所をクラフトし、建築ツールを使って設置する。そして、建築家を雇い(デフォルトでは自動で雇われる)、彼らに建築事務所を建てるように伝えよう！
advancements.minecolonies.click_gui_butt: Fulfill one of the Builder's requests for tools or resources using the buttons in their request screen
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: Citizens need to eat to be able to work. Put some food in your citizens' inventories so they can eat it when they need to!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Your Builder can learn 2x2 recipes. Teach them the recipe for a torch and they'll craft it when needed
Keep your Builder fed and fulfill their requests until they finish building your first hut
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: So this is what kind of leader you are, feeding your citizens rotten flesh? Shame, shame, shame!
advancements.minecolonies.build.lumberja: Complete building a Forester's Hut (use your build tool to place it) to collect wood for more huts
advancements.minecolonies.build.miner.de: Complete building a Mine (use your build tool to place it) to get some ores and cobble for your huts
advancements.minecolonies.build.guard_to: Build a Guard Tower and hire a Guard to protect against others who may begin to notice your growing town!
advancements.minecolonies.build.farmer.d: To start food production for your citizens, build a Farm. You'll need to place the Field (scarecrow) to mark where your Farmer will farm.
Your citizens need a place to live! Build them a House - each level houses one citizen.
advancements.minecolonies.citizen.bury.d: Bury your first citizen. It's a sad day for everyone, but better than letting their grave decay away.
advancements.minecolonies.citizen.resurr: Your Undertaker resurrected a fallen citizen!
advancements.minecolonies.build.tavern.d: Your citizens need a roof over their heads! Build a Tavern for some initial housing. You can also recruit citizens there!
advancements.minecolonies.build.town_hal: Construct the Town Hall. There are only a couple of benefits currently, but it's a cool centerpiece!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: Time for more citizens! Children may be born when two citizens of opposite gender are in the same house during the night. Children need to be fed and sleep well to grow up.
advancements.minecolonies.build.warehous: Need some automation? Build a Warehouse to store materials in a central location!
advancements.minecolonies.build.delivery: Build a Courier's Hut and hire a Courier so they can fulfill worker requests automatically!
With the Courier by your side, you can utilise crafters! Build the Sawmill to start your crafting experience.
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Teach your new Carpenter to craft a door. Note: Crafters will only craft when another worker makes a request. See the info tab in their hut for more!
advancements.minecolonies.build.stonemas: A Stonemason can craft 3x3 recipes using stone as their main ingredient. Build one to take advantage of their skill!
advancements.minecolonies.build.smeltery: Build a Smeltery to have ore smelted for you! It's pretty efficient with a skilled worker.
advancements.minecolonies.build.stone_sm: Build a Stone Smeltery to automate the forging of stone and more for other crafters
advancements.minecolonies.build.baker.de: Your citizens need some grains in their diet. Build a Bakery so the Baker can craft baked goods for them!
advancements.minecolonies.build.blacksmi: Most citizens need some form of tool. Build the Blacksmith's Hut to allow automated crafting of tools!
advancements.minecolonies.build.barracks: You're going to need many more Guards. Build a Barracks to hire a lot more in a much smaller space!
Build the Barracks Towers inside your new Barracks. These towers are locked to the same level as the Barracks and will increase their max Guards every level!
advancements.minecolonies.build.chicken_: Build a Chicken Farmer's Hut to bring in some eggs and meat. Remember to bring the chickens to the hut.
advancements.minecolonies.build.combat_a: Battle is dangerous. Build a Combat Academy and assign a citizen to train there without the risk of losing their life!
advancements.minecolonies.build.composte: A Composter will take your leftover saplings, leaves, and like items and expose them to the elements to make fertilizer.
advancements.minecolonies.build.cook.des: Build a Restaurant to give your citizens a place to get food. The Cook will cook meats and give food to you and your citizens.
advancements.minecolonies.build.cowboy.d: Build a Cowhand's Hut to bring in that beef. Remember to bring the cows to your Cowhand.
Build a Crusher's Hut to get things like gravel from cobblestone!
advancements.minecolonies.build.fisherma: Build a Fisher's Hut close to water to bring in those deep sea morsels
If you want more skilled labor, you'd best build a Library to educate your citizens!
advancements.minecolonies.build.shepherd: Build a Shepherd's Hut to take advantage of those poor unsuspecting sheep
advancements.minecolonies.build.sifter.d: Build a Sifter's Hut to take advantage of extra resources hiding in blocks
advancements.minecolonies.build.swine_he: Bacon - a meat eater's dream. Build a Swineherd's Hut so your citizens don't miss out.
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Upgrade your Builder's Hut so you can upgrade other huts too!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: 10 Citizens means more workers, and more workers means more resources!
25 Citizens is a lot, hopefully you're keeping them alive!
50 Citizens is enough to have one of each worker - and then some!
You settled. You survived. You thrived.
advancements.minecolonies.build.smeltery: A level 3 Smeltery has a 100% chance of doubling ore output, nice!
A level 5 Smeltery has a chance of tripling every ore output, the chance is equal to the worker's Strength level!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: While there's little benefit to having a level 5 Town Hall, it sure does look pretty!
Give your Knights some backup. Build an Archery to train Archers.

advancements.minecolonies.build.enchante: The Enchanter's Tower will consume ancient tomes and other workers' experience to produce enchanted books
advancements.minecolonies.check_out_guid: Right-click the Builder's Hut to see how things work

advancements.minecolonies.build.mystical: A Mystical Site may be pointless. It will only make your citizens proud. But you want one, so you should research and build one!

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
建築家はあなたのコロニーの心臓とも言える存在です。彼ら無しではあなたは何もできないことでしょう！
 建築家を除くすべての小屋の労働者は、何かをするために少なくともレベル1の建物が必要です。 もし建築家がレベル0の小屋(小屋がない)なら、彼らは建築事務所のみを建てることができます。

 建築家が自身の小屋以外を建設、アップグレード、再配置、修理するためには、自分の小屋(建築事務所)が他の小屋と同じレベル以上である必要があります。例えば、レベル3の小屋を建てるには建築事務所はレベル3以上でなければなりません。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
建築家の制約を網羅しましょう:

 1. 建築家 (と他のほとんどの労働者) は小屋のレベルに応じて、特定の道具のレベルを解除します:
   レベル0. 木/金の道具
   レベル1. 石の道具
   レベル2. 鉄の道具
   レベル4. ダイヤモンドの道具
   レベル5. エンチャントされた道具

2. 建築家の自動割り当ての建物の最大範囲は100ブロックです。建物がその範囲の外側なら、建築オプションGUIの右上（建てたい小屋の場合）で、その建物に割り当てる建築家を選択することができます。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
よくある質問を網羅しておきましょう:

 Q 1. 必要な資源のページで、入手不可能と思われるアイテムや、入手にシルクタッチを必要とするアイテムが表示されています。どうすればよいですか？?
A 1. 空気ブロックや草の道などのブロックは、必要な資源のタブに時々表示されます。これらは表示されますが、主に建築家の個人の要求タブに注目してください。 通常、正しいブロックを要求し、それに応じて変換してくれます (例: 土を要求し、シャベルを使って道にする)。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
すべての労働者がのように、建築家も働きながらレベルアップしていきます。
 より高いレベルでは建築家のスピード上昇します。 小屋のレベルや知能のスキルが高いほど、早くレベルアップします。 
 ただし、そのレベルは自宅のレベルによって上限が決まっています。 そのため、生活環境に不満があれば、あなたがより良い住居を提供するまでレベリングをしなくなります。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: 家は市民が生活する場所です。家のレベルと同じ人数の市民が住めます。全員に家を提供するためには、複数の家が必要になります。 家に住まない市民は、あなたの衛兵だけです。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: 子どもを授かるためには、男性と女性の市民が1つの家に一緒に住む必要があります。同じ小屋に部屋がなくても、コロニー内のハウスや酒場に空きベッドがあれば、子どもを産むことができます。他の家に大人がいれば、その人の養子となりその人の姓を名乗ることになります。小屋に大人がいないなら、子どもにはランダムな名前が与えられます。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: 労働者のレベルには、自身の家のレベルによる上限があります。そのため、生活環境に不満があれば、あなたがより良い住居を提供するまでレベリングをしなくなります。
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need a pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The Forester is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Forester to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Foresters unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Foresters are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally, we define a tree as a log and leaves next to each other. Due to this, some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the Forester. To counter this, you can place a piece of cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers do, Foresters level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Forester's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Warehouse is part of colony management. It's where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the Warehouse, but Couriers use the Warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the Couriers will not see/use those racks. You also cannot move the racks already in the building. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building. If the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by buying more on page 2 of the GUI using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my Warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the Builder. If you must move the Warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any Couriers don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pick up from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by the order the request is sent.

As all workers do, Couriers level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The Cook is part of the food production of your colony. The Cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes, as well as other cooked food that only needs a furnace.
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the Cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The Cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-cooked items for the Cook to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
As all workers do, the Cook levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cook's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The Baker is part of the food production of your colony. They will bake bread, cookies, pumpkin pie, and/or cake. On page two of the Bakery GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The Baker cannot make any food with items that are not consumed in the making like pots and pans. These are usually from mods like Pam's.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The Baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat/other ingredients may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers do, the Baker levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Baker's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Farmer grows crops for the colony. The Farmer can plant and harvest any crop that is planted in farmland, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers cannot grow plants that do not use farmland, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. These are grown by the Planter instead.
 Farmers can only maintain one field per each hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my Farmer not to grow crops up to the maximum size? 
   A 1. Use the Field GUI to set the size of the field.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers do, the Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Fisher is part of the food production of your colony. Simply put, the Fisher will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing rod and a big enough area of water.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The Fisher needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at the same level as the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Fisher is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The Fishermen can catch other items, same as a player can.

As all workers do, the Fisher levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Fisher's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The Chicken Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Chicken Farmer breeds, raises, and butchers chickens. They will collect eggs, feathers, and meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Chicken Farmer will keep two chickens alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chicken Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided for the Chicken Farmer to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Chicken Farmer need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The Chicken Farmer also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Chicken Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Chicken Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The Swineherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Swineherd breeds, raises, and butchers pigs. They will collect the meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Swineherd will keep two pigs alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Swineherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided for the Swineherd to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Swineherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two pigs to get things started. The Swineherd also needs carrots to breed the pigs and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Swineherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Swineherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The Shepherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Shepherd breeds, raises, shears, and butchers sheep. They will collect the meat and wool, as well as any drops from other mods. The Shepherd will keep two sheep alive per level of their hut. If you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can tell the Shepherd to randomly dye sheep to get colored wool.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Shepherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two sheep must be provided for the Shepherd to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Shepherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two sheep to get things started. The Shepherd also needs wheat to breed the sheep, shears to shear the wool, and an axe to butcher the sheep.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.3:
As all workers do, the Shepherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Shepherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The Cowhand is part of the food production of your colony. The Cowhand breeds, raises, and butchers cows. They will collect the meat and leather, as well as any drops from other mods. The Cowhand will keep two cows alive per level of their hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Cowhands unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two cows must be provided for the Cowhand to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Cowhand need to work?
   A 1. You need to s at least two cows to get things started. The Cowhand also needs wheat to breed the cows and an axe to butcher them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.3:
As all workers do, the Cowhand levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cowhand's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The Composter will turn items into compost for Farmers and Florists to use.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the Composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the hut GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts!

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, but these must be added in the MineColonies configuration file. This is found in (your instance folder)/config/minecolonies-common.toml.

As all workers do, the Composter levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Composter's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower:
The Guard Tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each Guard Tower employs one Guard. However, the Guard will also live in the tower, freeing up a bed for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Guard Tower was leveled up, but the Guard isn't asking for higher-level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guard levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto:
The Barracks Tower is the heart of your military defense. Each Barracks Tower employs 1 Guard per level for a total of 5. However, the Guards will also live in the tower, freeing up beds for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Barracks Tower was leveled up, but the Guards aren't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guards level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The Barracks is the heart of your military defense. Without it you wouldn't be able to build any Barracks Towers!
 Each Barracks contains four Barracks Towers, one for each level (up to level four).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 Barracks Tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the Barracks. So if you have a level 1 Barracks, it will only allow 1 Barracks Tower with a max level of 1. If you have a level 3 Barracks, it will allow 3 Barracks Towers with a max level of 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than 1 Barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the Barracks Tower levels are based on the Barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one Barracks that is level 5, if the second Barracks is only level 1, then that Barracks can only have a single level 1 tower.
The Graveyard is the resting place of your fallen citizens!

Without it, you'll still be able to manually collect fallen citizens' graves, but your colony will mourn longer.

Each Graveyard needs an Undertaker, who collects graves within the city.

During their free time, the Undertaker will get to know citizens and visit the Mystical Site, slowly attuning to the mana of the world.

If their Mana skill is high, the Undertaker has a small chance to resurrect a fallen citizen!

You can increase this chance by upgrading the Graveyard, building a Mystical Site, and completing researches in the University.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.rabbitherde: Attempts to keep the rabbit population in check.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.sawmill: Crafts most things that are made primarily from wood.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.smelter: Smelts ore (double or triple at higher levels).
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.stonemason: Crafts things made from various kinds of stone.

com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.swineherder: Just happy with pigs in mud.
